problem_array.name: P_2_1_Letter_Dimensions
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that computes and returns the dimensions of a letter-size (8.5 x 11 inches) sheet of paper in millimeters. There are 25.4 millimeters per inch. Use constants and comments in your method.

problem_array.name: P_2_2_Letter_perimeter
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that computes and returns the perimeter of a letter-size (8.5 x 11 inches) sheet of paper and the length of its diagonal.

problem_array.name: P_2_3_powerFunctions
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that takes a number and returns its square, cube, and fourth power.

dafny.method_signature: power_functions(x: int) returns (sq: int, cube : int, fourth: int)

problem_array.name: P_2_4_1_sum
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that prompts the user for two integers and then returns the sum.

problem_array.name: P_2_4_2_difference
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that takes two integers and then returns the difference.

problem_array.name: P_2_4_3_product
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that takes two integers and then returns the product.

problem_array.name: P_2_4_4_avarage
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that takes two integers and then returns the average.

problem_array.name: P_2_4_5_distance
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that takes two integers and then returns the distance (absolute value of the difference).

ensures: if x >= y then result == x - y else result == y - x

problem_array.name: 2_4_6_max
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that prompts the user for two integers and then returns the maximum (the larger of the two).

ensures: if x >= y then result == x else result == y

problem_array.name: 2_4_7_min
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that prompts the user for two integers and then returns the minimum (the smaller of the two).

ensures: if x <= y then result == x else result == y

problem_array.name: 2_6_convert
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that prompts the user for a measurement in meters and then converts it to miles, feet, and inches.

dafny.method_signature: convert(x: real) returns (miles: real, feet: real, inches: real)

problem_array.name: 2_7_circle_properties
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that prompts the user for a radius and then returns the area and circumference of a circle with that radius and the volume and surface area of a sphere with that radius.

dafny.method_signature: circle_properties(radius: real) returns (circumference: real, area: real, surface_area: real, volume: real)

problem_array.name: 2_8_rectangle_properties
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that takes the lengths of the sides of a rectangle. Then return the area and perimeter of the rectangle and the length of the diagonal (use the Pythagorean theorem).

dafny.method_signature: rectangle_properties(length: real, width: real) returns (area: real, perimeter: real, diagonal: real)
ensures: diagonal * diagonal == length * length + width * width

problem_array.name: 2_10_hybrid_car_cost
problem_array.nat_lang_statement: Write a method that helps a person decide whether to buy a hybrid car. Your methods's inputs should be: the cost of a new car, the estimated miles driven per year, the estimated gas price, the efficiency in miles per gallon, the estimated resale value after 5 years. Compute the total cost of owning the car for five years.

dafny.method_signature: hybrid_car_cost(new_car_cost: real, miles_per_year: real, gas_price: real, mpg: real, resale_value: real) returns (total_cost: real)
